title: CAKE Online Ordering System (OLO)
description: CAKE Online Ordering creates a new revenue stream for restaurants, enhancing online presence and eliminating third-party fees. Customers can order ahead via mobile or desktop, schedule orders, and enjoy seamless POS integration, reducing errors with a single menu. The platform allows custom branding and dish images, offers contactless payments with Apple Pay, Google Pay, and credit card options, and provides hassle-free curbside management with two-way text communication. My role involved developing web interfaces, native iOS views for onboarding, testing UI flows on iPad, creating UI test cases for React Storybook, and wireframing new features.

title: End-to-End Architecture and Automation for Component Libraries
description: In this project, I was involved with requirement gathering and problem solving. I directly worked with the design system architecture team as a middle layer between the design team and dev teams. Responsibilities included making the component library architecture, selecting technology and tools, automating the release process, automating release notes, automating release note Slack alerts, handling unit and integration testing, improving bundle size and performance optimization, automated Figma to GitHub design token syncing, and automated static Storybook version hosting with each library release.

title: Architecting and Implementing Microfrontends for Scalable Applications
description: In this project, I led the design and development of a scalable microfrontend architecture for our client. My role involved making key architectural decisions and guiding the implementation of microfrontends across multiple applications. We created a proof of concept (POC) and researched various technologies like React, Next.js, Webpack Module Federation, and Plugin Federation to determine the best solutions for the microfrontend framework. I also developed strategies for shared state management, secure authentication, and protected routes. Through testing different deployment strategies and frameworks, we successfully delivered a robust and scalable microfrontend architecture that met the client’s needs.
